title: Domain of log functions
text: The domain of the log function $$f(x)=\log_{a}\left(x\right)$$ is $$(0,\infty)$$.
speech: The domain of the log function  f of x is equal to the log base a of x,  is , the open interval from 0 to infinity .

is  , the open interval from 0 to infinity

title: Transformations
text: $$f(x)=\ln(5-2x)$$ translates the parent function $$5$$ units left, horizontally shrinks it by a factor of $$\frac{1}{2}$$, and reflects it across the y-axis.
speech: f of x is equal to the natural log of, parentheses, 5 minus 2 x,   translates the parent function  5  units left, horizontally shrinks it by a factor of  1 half , and reflects it across the y-axis.

units left, horizontally shrinks it by a factor of   1 half
, and reflects it across the y-axis.
